for mass production or factory manufacturing of any kind the tempest beanie above the clouds crochet materials  i/5 5mm hook  j/6 0mm hook  1 skein facet stones yarn note if you want to make the matching scarf the tempest scarf free pattern in my ravelry shop to go with your beanie you will need 2 skeins or you can use any worsted weight yarn around 200 yds for just the beanie and roughly 475 yds for the scarf/beanie set  scissors  tapestry needle measurements pattern is written in size adult regular only however foundation chain is worked in multiples of 2 therefore adjusting your beanie size is simple just use a hat sizing chart for your measurements adult regular measurements hat band beginning fhdc row should measure 18 -19 long before joining total hat height should measure 8 5 -9 abbreviations chain = chain fhdc = foundation half_double_crochet st s = stitch s decrease = double_crochet 2 together slip_stitch = slip_stitch fpdc = front post double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet yo = yarn over half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet skill level beginner/intermediate special stitches foundation half_double_crochet fhdc if you are unfamiliar with how to do this stitch then your best bet is to find a tutorial on youtube there s tons out there a video will be a much better explanation/visual than i can ever offer note alternatively if you are not comfortable trying the fhdc you can loosely chain 62 with your i/5 50mm hook join to first chain to form a loop chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as join and in each chain around slip_stitch to first half_double_crochet of the round this is your foundation row double_crochet 2 together decrease yarn over yo insert hook in specified stitch and pull up a loop 3 loops on hook yo pull through two loops yo insert hook in next st and pull up a loop yo pull through two loops yo pull through remaining three loops on hook front post double_crochet fpdc yo insert hook from front to back between the posts of the first and second sts from the round below and then from back to front again between the posts of the second and third sts yo draw yarn around the post of the st yo pull through 2 loops yo pull through remaining 2 loops bpdc worked opposite from the fpdc yo insert hook from back to front between the posts of the first and second sts from the round below and then from front to back again between
